description: The navigator is a small series below the main series, displaying a view of the entire data set. It provides tools to zoom in and out on parts of the data as well as panning across the dataset.

children.name: adaptToUpdatedData
children.description: Whether the navigator and scrollbar should adapt to updated data in the base X axis. When loading data async, as in the demo below, this should be false. Otherwise new data will trigger navigator redraw, which will cause unwanted looping. In the demo below, the data in the navigator is set only once. On navigating, only the main chart content is updated.

samples.name: Set to false with async data loading

children.name: baseSeries
children.description:
An integer identifying the index to use for the base series, or a string representing the id of the series.

Note: As of Highcharts 5.0, this is now a deprecated option. Prefer series.showInNavigator.

children.name: handles
children.description: Options for the handles for dragging the zoomed area.

children.name: margin
children.description: The distance from the nearest element, the X axis or X axis labels.

samples.name: A margin of 2 draws the navigator closer to the X axis labels

children.name: maskFill
children.description: The color of the mask covering the areas of the navigator series that are currently not visible in the main series. The default color is bluish with an opacity of 0.3 to see the series below.
see: In styled mode, the mask is styled with the .highcharts-navigator-mask and .highcharts-navigator-mask-inside classes.

children.name: maskInside
children.description: Whether the mask should be inside the range marking the zoomed range, or outside. In Highstock 1.x it was always false.

children.name: opposite
children.description: When the chart is inverted, whether to draw the navigator on the opposite side.

children.name: outlineColor
children.description: The color of the line marking the currently zoomed area in the navigator.

children.name: outlineWidth
children.description: The width of the line marking the currently zoomed area in the navigator.
see: In styled mode, the outline stroke width is set with the .highcharts-navigator-outline class.

children.name: series
children.description:
Options for the navigator series. Available options are the same as any series, documented at plotOptions and series.

Unless data is explicitly defined on navigator.series, the data is borrowed from the first series in the chart.

Default series options for the navigator series are:

series: {
    type: 'areaspline',
    fillOpacity: 0.05,
    dataGrouping: {
        smoothed: true
    },
    lineWidth: 1,
    marker: {
        enabled: false
    }
}

samples.name: Using a separate data set for the navigator

see: In styled mode, the navigator series is styled with the .highcharts-navigator-series class.

children.name: xAxis
children.description:
Options for the navigator X axis. Default series options for the navigator xAxis are:

xAxis: {
    tickWidth: 0,
    lineWidth: 0,
    gridLineWidth: 1,
    tickPixelInterval: 200,
    labels: {
           align: 'left',
        style: {
            color: '#888'
        },
        x: 3,
        y: -4
    }
}

children.name: yAxis
children.description:
Options for the navigator Y axis. Default series options for the navigator yAxis are:

yAxis: {
    gridLineWidth: 0,
    startOnTick: false,
    endOnTick: false,
    minPadding: 0.1,
    maxPadding: 0.1,
    labels: {
        enabled: false
    },
    title: {
        text: null
    },
    tickWidth: 0
}
